com.barrysheehan.www

Class CountingSort

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.barrysheehan.www.CountingSort
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sorter

    public class CountingSort
extends java.lang.Object
implements Sorter
    Sorts an int[] array using an implementation of Counting Sort, a stable non-comparison sorting algorithm.

    Counting Sort counts the frequency at which each distinct integer appears in an array and stores this values in a separate count array. The values in the count array are then used to populate a new array with the correct number of each value in sorted order.

    Since:
    1.8

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Specified by:
        getName in interface Sorter

      • sort

        public void sort(int[] arr)
        Sorts an array of integers into ascending order by counting the frequency at which each distinct integer appears in the array.

        A secondary count array is created to store the frequency at which each distinct integer appears in the input array. The value at each index in the count array is incremented when an integer with a value equal to that index is encountered in the input array.

        Once the input array has been iterated over, any value stored in the count array will refer to the number of times that that index number appears in the original input array.

        Finally, the value at each index of the count array is added to the value at the index that comes before it. The count array thus stores the position of the last appearance of its own index number in the final sorted array. The count array is then used to populate the final sorted array with the correct number of duplicates of each distinct integer from the input array.

        Specified by:
        sort in interface Sorter
        Parameters:
        arr - the integer array to be sorted
